entry.title: Front end engineer
entry.content:
I started my internet career as a HTML "programmer", and began using Javascript as soon as Netscape invented it in '96. Today, I write standard compliant, accessible, SEO optimized code using the popular Ajax friendly Javascript libraries such as JQuery, MooTools, PrototypeJS, YUI

I have used HTML (in all its flavours from HTML 3.2 to HTML 5 via XHTML), CSS, Javascript, for...

  • creating standard compliant, accessible websites

  • templating systems

  • online content management tools

  • email newsletters

  • established a house style for a team

  • training absolute beginners in those technologies

entry.title: PHP
entry.content:
I have used PHP for many years, it is my backend technology of choice for most projects.

With PHP, I have...

  • written complex server side applications from scratch

  • used frameworks such as Symfony, CodeIgniter, and Zend

  • customized PHP-based packages such as Drupal, Wordpress (which this site runs on)

  • worked with databases such as mySQL, PostgreSQL, MS-SQL, and SQLite

  • worked with XML, XSLT, and XPath

  • used third party APIs including Bebo, Facebook

  • written command line scripts to perform scheduled tasks/cron jobs

entry.title: Actionscript
entry.content:
I've been using Actionscript seriously since Flash 5, and progressed to AS2 and AS3. I am pretty much giving it up though, given the current HTML / Javascript reinassance.

With Actionscript, I have...

  • created frameworks for modular websites

  • built registration microsites, and banners

  • put together page flip magazines

  • created multilingual widgets

  • developed e-card applications

  • built widgets for social networks such as Bebo and Facebook

  • built simple games with high score tables

  • implemented kiosk applications

  • built online applications which send image data to a server for generating personalized tokens

entry.title: Ajax
entry.content:
Although not stricly Ajax, as no XML was passed, I have used Javascript and server side scripts to refresh parts of a web interfaces for quite some time.

With Ajax, I have...

  • built simple content management systems

  • built social applications on Facebook

entry.title: Production
entry.content:
Despite the job title of 'technical director', a large portion of my role at CMW London was technical production - in fact the person I replaced was an out and out producer. I scoped projects, wrote functional specifications, managed timelines, and QA'ed them.

In the distant past I run the production dept. of a small London agency for a few months.
